intro: Cupania dukei, commonly known as the Duke's cupuaçu, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the Amazon rainforest and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to cacao pods, containing a sweet, creamy pulp. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland areas with rich, well-drained soil. Due to its unique botanical features and potential economic value, it is of interest to botanists and agricultural researchers.
